title: الصِّفَة الْمُشَبَّهَة (٢)
description: Learn how الصِّفَة الْمُشَبَّهَة differs from اسم الفاعل and understand its grammatical behavior in sentences.

notes.title: الصفة المشبهة vs اسم الفاعل
notes.titleArabic: الفرق بين الصفة المشبهة واسم الفاعل
content: اسم الفاعل indicates a temporary action or state, while الصفة المشبهة indicates a permanent quality.
For example, ضَارِبٌ means 'one who is hitting (now)', while كَرِيمٌ means 'one who is inherently generous'.
keyPoints: اسم الفاعل: temporary state - ضَارِبٌ (hitting), قَائِمٌ (standing)
الصفة المشبهة: permanent quality - كَرِيمٌ (generous), شُجَاعٌ (brave)
اسم الفاعل from transitive verbs, الصفة المشبهة from intransitive
Both agree in gender and number with the noun they describe

examples.english: The man is hitting the boy now (temporary)

notes.title: Grammatical Behavior
content: الصفة المشبهة can take a connected noun (معمول) in the genitive case, showing what the quality relates to.
For example: حَسَنُ الْوَجْهِ (beautiful of face), كَرِيمُ الأَصْلِ (noble of origin).
keyPoints: Can govern a noun in genitive: طَيِّبُ الْقَلْبِ (good-hearted)
Agrees with its noun in definiteness and case
Often used as predicates: الْبِنْتُ حَسَنَةُ الْخُلُقِ
Can also be used as attributive adjectives

examples.english: The woman is old (lit: big of age)
I saw a man with a beautiful face
They are tall (lit: tall of stature)

exercises.promptEn: He is a _____ man in war

exercises.prompt: The man is noble of origin
